BRODSKY--Judith. You are always in our hearts. Love, Grace and Ruth

WIESELTIER--Stella, passed away June 20th/Tammuz 12. Beloved mother of Leon and Thea, grandmother of Joshua, Isabel and Matthew. A magnificent woman. Shiva will take place at 131 Hastings Street in Brooklyn from Sunday morning to Thursday morning.
ULLMAN--William Anthony. To the best bro a sister could have. I so miss you and all the good times we shared together with Nancy and Alec. I love you, always have, always will. Susan

SCHWEBER--Laura, 92. Beloved wife of the late Seymour Schweber. Died peacefully on June 20th, 2013. Loving sister to Shirley and Herbert. Mother to Stephen (Leslie), Dennis (Ellen), Kenneth and Neal (Catherine). Grandmother to Scott (Tracey), Elisa, Brett (Kim), Darryl (Alan), Sloane (Josh), Arielle, Maximilien and Austen. Nephews and nieces, Joel, Judy, Wendy, Lynn, Glenn and Wendy and ten great-grandchildren. Laura was a patron of the arts and compassionate philanthropist. Family Matriarch who alway provided wisdom, love and devotion to all generations of her family, which shall truly be her legacy. She will be in our hearts forever. The Schweber Family

SCHNEIDER--Gertrude, born in New York City on January 10, 1917, died in Brooklyn on June 21, 2013. Daughter of the late Sophie and Joseph Reisman, and wife of the late Mickey Schneider. She is survived by her children, Ellen (Steve) and Lynn, two granddaughters and four great-grandchildren. Beloved by all, including her many friends and extended family. We love you and will miss you.

RUBIN--Bunny, 81, of Westfield, NJ, born April 3, 1932 passed away on June 17. She was a beloved wife, mother and grandmother. Bunny's loving and precious soul will be deeply missed and forever in our hearts.

ROSEN--Murray M. In Memory of Murray M. Rosen Partner and founder of Rosen and Glaser C.P.A.s, P.C. our mentor, colleague and friend. Whom, by his example, showed us that life's true treasures are found in the relationships we keep, in those that we meet, and in the moments we share. We are privileged for having known him; mourn his passing; and wish him eternal peace. Rosen and Glaser C.P.A.s, P.C.

ROSENBLATT--Joseph B. We note with sorrow the passing of our longtime member Joseph B. Rosenblatt and extend sincerest condolences to his bereaved family. Rabbi Peter J. Rubinstein and President David B. Edelson, Central Synagogue of New York City
ROSENBLATT--Joseph B. You were my favorite brother, a very special and unusual guy. Love, Ruth Norek

ROSENBLATT--Joseph B. Joe was the quintessential New Yorker with a tremendous zest for life. He was a caring, involved individual- a nice, funny, interesting man- a lover of American antiques and politics and our neighbor in a nearby pew in synagogue, where we all loved to schmooze... before services, of course! Joe was our friend and supported all charitable and political parties we invited him to. Joe, we were all crazy about you and we will miss you. Loving thoughts and memories of you. Susan Zises Green Justin and Jenny Green Lynn Zises, Doug Krugman

ROSENBLATT--Joseph. UJA-Federation of New York mourns the passing of Joseph Rosenblatt, a dear friend deeply committed to the Jewish people and a philanthropic leader in the real estate community. Joseph's generosity has touched the lives of millions, his deep tradition of tzedakah will live on through his beloved family, his wife, Sheila, his sister, Ruth, his children Jill and Brad, Sarah and Sam, and Sam and Mario, and his many grandchildren. We extend our deepest sympathies to the entire family. Jerry W. Levin, President; Alisa R. Doctoroff, Chair of the Board; John S. Ruskay, Exec. VP & CEO

ROSENBLATT--Joseph. The Board of Trustees and staff of the Educational Alliance mourn the passing of Joseph Rosenblatt, father of our Trustee Samuel Rosenblatt. We offer our sincere condolences to Sam and to Joe's wife Sheila, his daughter's Jill and Sarah and the entire Rosenblatt family, all of who are generous supporters of our work.

ROSENBLATT--Joseph B. The Board of Trustees of Usdan Center for the Creative and Performing Arts mourns the passing of their beloved friend, colleague and Founding Trustee, Joseph B. Rosenblatt. From the Center's inception 46 years ago, Joe was a passionate guardian and generous supporter, providing children from all races and religions access to our programs. With care and concern, every summer, Joe would call our staff inquiring about the well being of our children and the progress of their studies at Usdan. To his wife Sheila, children Jill, Sarah and Sam, the Board sends its condolences. Joe's sense of humor, boundless curiosity and deeply felt connection to our mission and values, and above all his leadership, will be long remembered and sorely missed.

ROSENBLATT--Joseph, Goldberg Weprin mourns the passing of an esteemed citizen, our dear friend and client, Joe. Joe was a dean of New York real estate, accomplished, philanthropic, relentless in his commitments to political, community and charitable causes. His wisdom (and first questions) will be missed, as will his inspirational love for his family, especially his new miracle Twins. Our heartfelt condolences are extended to the entire family.

ROSENBLATT--Joseph B.,90, On June 21, 2013. Beloved husband of Sheila for 58 years. Father of Jill, Sarah, and Samuel. Grandfather of Ellen, Tory, Zachary, Ariel, Jared and Aidan. One of New York's greatest citizens. Active member of the New York real estate community for 65 years. Involved philanthropist in numerous charities including UJA, Israel Bonds, Eldridge Street Synagogue, the Usdan Center, and the Omega Ensemble. Founder of The Wizard's Corner devoted to the believe that every New York City child must have a dedicated safe desk space to effectively be able do their homework. We will miss your genuine interest in every idea and everyone you meet. Every industry and charity luncheon will miss your raising your hand to eagerly ask the first question. We will miss you Dad. Funeral Services Monday 11:30am at Frank E. Campbell (The Funeral Chapel) Madison Ave. at 81st. Street. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to the Educational Alliance 197 East Broadway New York, NY 10002.
ROBBINS--Raymond A.,MD, I just want to say goodbye. Ray

REQUENA--Louis, on June, 20th, 2013. Born December 12, 1919, devoted family man, World War II veteran, and sports photographer extraordinaire who had a 50 year career photographing some of the biggest names in baseball. Memorial Service to be held at Greenwich Village Funeral Home 199 Bleecker Street New York City, Tuesday, June 25th, 10:30am-12:30pm. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to the American Legion (legion.org) in Lou's name.

NATHANSON--Ellen. Died Friday morning after a long illness. Lifelong resident of NYC. She attended James Madison High School in Midwood, where she met her devoted husband of 55 years, Carl. They both graduated from Brooklyn College. A schoolteacher, an advocate for children, women and civil rights, she was also a longtime champion to improve the conditions of NYC public schools. She later held the position of VP at Dime Savings Bank in their Community Affairs Department. When she retired from banking, she turned to her childhood passion of painting and was determined to begin a new career as an artist rep, selling emerging artists' works on the East End of Long Island. She continued as an art consultant for several years, until declining health made such work impossible. In addition to Carl, Ellen is survived by her three loving children, Michael, Caryn and Steven, their spouses, Tracy, Jeff and Debbie, and seven grandchildren, whom she adored. Service 12:30pm Monday at Temple Emanu-el at Fifth Ave and 65th Street. Burial will be private. She will be greatly missed.

MINCER--Flora Ruth Kaplan, M.D.,age 88, on June 20. Born July 29, 1924, in Philadelphia to Isador Kaplan, M.D., and Mollie Epstein Kaplan. Radiation oncologist (B.A., M.D., University of Pennsylvania) at Montefiore, Albert Einstein, and Calvary hospitals. Devoted wife of Professor Jacob Mincer (died 2006). Adored mother of Daniel (died 1981 from cardiac complications of Marfan Syndrome), Deborah, and Carolyn. Also survived by son-in-law Richard, beloved grandchildren Isaac and Nina, sister Judy, nephew Andrew. Will be remembered for her innate kindness, quick wit, and a passion for flowers, trees, and her sunsets over the Hudson. Donations: New York Botanical Garden or National Marfan Foundation.

MILLER--Saul, On June 21, 2013 at age 90. Born in East New York on March 4, 1923. The "Lox Man", beloved son of Becky and Sam Miller, brother to Frances, Ruby, Florence, and Esther. A proud Navy veteran of WWII, and a loving uncle, great-uncle and great-great-uncle to 46 nieces and nephews, who loved him dearly. Saul had countless friends, whom he loved to "treat to care packages". His passions ranged from horse racing to smoked fish, as well as getting in a third or fourth mile in the neighborhood park, even at 90. His generosity and robust spirit will live on in all those he touched. He will be missed dearly, and his memory cherished.

Mandelbaum--Laurence, We mourn the loss of our son- and brother-in-law, uncle and great-uncle, who blessed our family with guidance, generosity and integrity. We will forever miss his warmth and compassion.

KROCHAK--Joseph, on June 22, 2013. Beloved husband of Edith. Devoted father of Fran, Michael, Howard and Donna. Cherished grandfather of Jessica, Ryan, Jason, Adam, Sam and Alex and great-grandfather of Kaiden. We will miss your sense of humor and loving smile.

HOFFELD--Arthur J. Born in Brooklyn, August 30, 1922. Husband of the late Bernice Hoffeld. Father of Jeffrey and the late Steven Hoffeld. Father-in-law of Carol Fein Hoffeld. Grandfather of Noah, Jeremy, and Anna Rose Hoffeld; Samoa Wilson and Ioana Boambes. Great-grandfather of Elona Hoffeld. Beloved Uncle and friend. Graveside service Tuesday, 1:30pm at the New Montefiore Cemetery, West Babylon NY. Donations in his memory may be made to Children's Defense Fund.

GOTTHELF--Toby. (1927-2013), beloved daughter of Goldie and Jack Solow, brought up in the Bronx, overlooking Yankee stadium. graduated Taft high school and NYU 1949 majoring in political science. Divorced spouse of the late Theodore J. Gotthelf, incredible mother of Terri, Tommy and Tia; caring step-mother of Nicole and Eric, adoring grandmother of five amazing boys: Tyler, Teddy, Tucker, Wyatt and Levi, loving mother-in-law to Will Obering and to Debbie Gotthelf. Toby's house with its neon Club Toby sign welcomed friends, family and neighbors where food, sweets and love were plentiful. Avid sports fan, bridge master, tennis player, who embraced the energy of New York City. Toby enjoyed boating and the love of the sea. She was an adventurous, fearless traveller who explored the globe extensively with her family. Her life was dedicated to her children, family and friends. Funeral services will be held noon, June 25th at Sunset Chapels, 1285 Northern Blvd, in Manhasset. She will be buried next to her beloved daughter Terri. Now they will be together forever.
GOHL--Fredrick Herbert, Sr.,96, died June 20, 2013 in Naples, FL. For full obituary and service information, visit www.fullernaples.com.
FELDESMAN--Walter. With everlasting gratitude for your integrity, intellect and wisdom. There will never be another you. Gerry and Lois Kirsh

FELDESMAN--Walter, on June 22, 2013. Beloved husband of the late Lucille. Devoted father of Alyn Dauman, Jan Rudikoff and Jimmy Feldesman and father-in-law of Steven Dauman, Jill Feldesman and the late Michael Rudikoff. Cherished grandfather of Robert and Jonathan Dauman, Richard and Jennie Rudikoff and Jared and Jessica Feldesman. Services Monday 11:30am, at "The Riverside" 76 Street and Amsterdam Avenue.

FELDESMAN--Walter, noted lawyer and author, 95, died on Saturday, June 22, 2013, at his Manhattan home. He attended New York University (1937) and Harvard Law School (1940). At 23, he received the Medal of Army Accommodation from the Secretary of War for a supply plan adopted by all military branches. After his own law firm, he partnered with Summit Rovins & Feldesman, then retired from Brown Raysman Millstein Felder & Steiner. He worked in many areas of law, later specializing in pro bono Elder Law. He gifted Medicare with their first dictionary of terms, releasing in April his 707-page Dictionary of Eldercare Terminology, 3rd edition, the only text of its kind used by Medicare and lay people. In 1983, The New York Times named him among six lawyers to sit on the most public boards. Accomplishments: Board Member for Sterling Bancorp until age 90 and E.G. Bowman Co. to his death; first Lawyer of the Year awardee from National Conference of Christians and Jews; Trustee of Beth Israel Hospital; Founder of Albert Einstein College of Medicine, Yeshiva University; member Fenway Country Club and Friar's Club. His wife of 58 years, Lucille Abramson Feldesman, predeceased him in 2000. He is survived by children: Alyn and Steven Dauman, Manhattan; Jan Rudicoff, (widow of Michael) Boca Raton; Jill and James Feldesman, Rye Brook; and grandchildren Robert, Jonathan, Richard, Jared, Jennie and Jessica.

ERLEBACHER--Martha Mayer, age 75, of Elkins Park, Pensylvannia, died on June 22, 2013. She was devoted wife of the late Walter S. Erlebacher and the loving mother of Adrian Erlebacher and Jonah Erlebacher. She is also survived by her brother, Edward Mayer, and by four grandchildren. Services will be private. Memorial contributions may be made to the New York Academy of Art, for the Martha and Walter Erlebacher Scholarship Fund. (www.nyaa.edu). Baron Rowland Funeral Home (www.baronrowlandfh.com)

DEARING--Peter Grubb, 66, died peacefully after an 18-month battle with cancer on June 18th, at home in Manhattan. Born in 1947 in Louisville, KY, Peter graduated from St. George's School (Rhode Island) in 1965. He received a B.A. in history from Harvard in 1969, then joined the Navy, became a Lieutenant JG, and served for three years as Engineering Officer aboard the USS Van Voorhis, a destroyer escort. Peter earned a law degree from Case Western Reserve in 1975 and an MBA from Columbia in 1980. After early careers in law and advertising, Peter discovered his calling as an educator, and spent more than 20 rewarding years on the faculty at the Winston Preparatory School in the city, teaching learning disabled high school students. He is survived by his wife, Jeffrey Zeiler; son, Peter S. Dearing, daughter, Stewart C. Dearing all of New York City; and sister, Peggy Hooker, of New Canaan, CT. He was predeceased by his older brother, A. Chenault Dearing. There will be a private service at the Cathedral of St. John the Divine in the city. Donations may be made in Peter's name to the National Down Syndrome Society in honor of his friend, Carson Goodwin.

BOLLMAN--McWilliam V.,of Bronxville, NY, born in Chicago, IL, March 25, 1930 to Fred and Louise Bollman, beloved husband of Lucy Roesler Bollman, passed away on June 21, 2013. He is survived by his children Mac Jr. (Shelly) of Clifton, VA and Elly Schmidt (Tony) of California, MD, and his four grandchildren. He attended Princeton ('51) and earned his BA from NYU. He was a U.S. Navy pilot from 1950 to 1955 and had a career in international trade. A visitation will be held at McGrath's Funeral Home in Bronxville, NY from 5 to 7pm, June 27. The funeral is at 11:30am, June 30 at Mountain Grove Memorial Church, Huletts Landing, NY. In lieu of flowers, please send donations to Calvary Hospital, 1740 Eastchester Rd., Bronx, NY, 10461 or The Reform Church of Bronxville, PO Box 397, Bronxville, NY, 10708.

Congress must let gun victims sue reckless gun manufacturers.

With New York City’s murder rate at a historic low, the Police Department has shifted attention and resources to fatal automobile accidents.
Ken Duke won the Travelers Championship with a short birdie putt on the second hole of a playoff against Chris Stroud.

Once worth $34.5 billion, Eike Batista’s holdings are now estimated at $4.8 billion and falling. With Brazil’s streets churning in protest, the markets — and Mr. Batista’s fortune — are on uncertain terrain.

Despite all the childhood sacrifices and adult setbacks, Tommy Haas has never lost his passion for the game. Competing at his 14th at Wimbledon, he is seeded No. 13, which he has long considered his lucky number.

Fans rush to buy their favorite TV series and movies as soon as they are available. Top 10 titles released the week of June 8 include “Identity Thief,” starring Melissa McCarthy.
After a renovation, the Forest Hills Tennis Stadium, which played host to Jimmy Connors and John Lennon, will be the site of 19 concerts over the next three years.
Several former governors and public officials have recently found themselves under investigation or facing public scorn.
On his first visit to India as secretary of state, John Kerry urged the nation to take action against global warming.

Lawyers in every case that was argued this term, including the ones on same-sex marriage, affirmative action and voting rights expected to be decided this week, first honed their arguments in a moot courtroom at Georgetown Law School.

While legal issues are seldom on golfers’ minds, players must be aware of the potential lawsuits that lurk at golf courses.

A proposal to build a $173 million arena with public and private money has upset critics who prefer the city stave off school closures.
A look at performances from this year’s citywide festival celebrating the summer solstice.
After episodes of mass shootings, Hollywood has offered to alert parents to the presence of violence in films. But the guns, on blazing display in this summer’s movie fare, are staying.
A Colorado school district discriminated against a transgender first grader when it refused to let her use the girl’s bathroom, the state’s civil rights division determined.
Publishers of prominent publications have embraced the concept of publishing multiple covers in a single month, hoping to lure more readers and advertisers.
Ivan Nova returned to the majors and had his longest outing of the season and seven strikeouts, but the Yankees’ offense was anemic on Old-Timers’ Day.
Mr. Flippo, a dean of pop music journalism who wrote for Rolling Stone, insisted on profiling musicians like Willie Nelson and Dolly Parton during an era of rock celebrity mania.

A few people who could be top-of-the-tree bridge players give up the game to concentrate on family and career. One of those was Lawrence Rosler, who died on May 29.

RIPPS--David. June 25, 1967. Remembered on his birthday and everyday with love. Mom, Dad, Van, Leah & Emily
PLAYTEN--Alice 1947-2011 Actoringer - light of my life for 35 years Love forever Joshua
O'BRIEN--Lois, You are ever on our minds. Rest In Peace, beloved. Jack and Jeremiah

WORTMAN--Gisela. The community of West End Synagogue, A Reconstructionist Congregation, mourns the loss of Gisela Wortman, our member and mother of our members Marcel Laufer and his wife Evelyn Attia Laufer, our newly elected president. Dr. Wortman, a psychiatrist, was innovative, pro-active, gutsy to the point of courageous, qualities that served her well as a survivor. She was also one of the prettiest older ladies the world has known. Our sympathies to all her family.

WILLIAMS--Basil Jr.,died on June 23rd. Beloved husband of 53 years to Karlene, wonderful father to Basil and Daphne, magical grandfather to Hayden, Kyra, David and Joseph, beloved eldest brother to Robert and Donald, and irreplaceable father-in-law to Heather and George. His family was always first in his life. Whenever you asked Basil how he was, he'd say "100 percent!" and that's how he lived his life. He loved completely and enjoyed every minute of every day. He graduated from Columbia University, earning his BS, MS and MBA. For over 60 years, he was a financial advisor, untimely at Wells Fargo, winning many awards. He was respected and loved by his clients and colleagues. He worked until the end because he loved what he did. He was a devoted member of the Greek Orthodox Church and very involved with The Cathedral of St. John the Theologian in Tenafly, NJ. He was distinguished and honorable in every aspect of his life, a legacy which will live in his family. Viewing will be held from 4:00-8:00pm on Wednesday at the Barrett Funeral Home in Tenafly, NJ. Funeral services will be held at 11:00am on Thursday at The Cathedral of St. John the Theologian. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to St. Michael's Home for the Aged, 3 Lehman Terrace, Yonkers, NY 10705.

TUCKER--Selma, 92, of Great Neck, NY, died June 22. Survived by a large and loving family and predeceased by her husband of 65 years, William. A lifelong dancer, learner and social justice crusader. Funeral at Plaza Jewish Community Chapel, Manhattan, June 25 at 11am.

SUNSHINE--Edwin H.,87, CPA, LLB, JD on June 23, 2013. Devoted son of the late Rose and Emanuel James Sunshine. Beloved husband of Susan, adoring father of Yael (Jill) Sunshine and wonderful stepdad to Jody Kessler. Dear Grandpa of Hazon, Shoshana, Baruch, Chava and Jasmine. Brother of the late Alleyne Miller. Ed attended Carnegie Tech and was a graduate of Rutgers and Brooklyn Law. A very proud New Yorker, Ed was especially honored to have served his country overseas in the United States Navy during WWII. Contributions in his memory may be made to the 92nd Street Y School of Arts, designated to the Jewelry and Ceramics Depts., 1395 Lexington Ave., NY, NY 10128. Attn: Susan Lewen. Memorial celebration to be announced at a later date.

SKOLNICK--Holly. The attorneys and staff of Greenberg Traurig mourn the loss of Holly, a beloved colleague, talented lawyer, mentor and friend in the Miami office. A native New Yorker, Skolnick, chaired the firm's Pro Bono initiative and was President/ Founder of the Greenberg Traurig Fellowship Foundation. Her amazing drive for justice and passion for giving back to our communities made her stand out. We extend our deepest sympathy to her family. Donations can be made in Skolnick's name to Americans for Immigrant Justice in Miami.

RUBIN--Bunny, 81, of Westfield, NJ, born April 3, 1932 passed away on June 17. She was a beloved wife, mother and grandmother. Bunny's loving and precious soul will be deeply missed and forever in our hearts.

O'ROURKE--Catherine Marie, age 96. After a brief illness, of heart failure, on June 23, 2013. Born Catherine Marie Burchie, March 8, 1917, on Staten Island. In 1947, married Charles O'Rourke, who served with the NYPD for over 20 years. Her husband predeceased her in 1992. Moved to Stuyvesant Town in Manhattan as a bride in 1948, where she lived until 2004, when she moved to Lott Assisted Living Residence at 108th and 5th Ave. Survived by her son, Terrence J. O'Rourke, and her daughter-in-law, Melinda Roberts O'Rourke, of New York City and Sewickley Heights, PA. Also survived by her niece, Dr. Barbara Naiman Young of Philadelphia and her nephew, Deacon Donald Naiman of Danbury, CT. Service on Wednesday, June 26. Calling at 10am, Funeral Service at 11am at Andrett Funeral Home, 353 Second Ave., between 20th and 21st, NYC, 212-475-2024. Memorial donations to Lott Assisted Living Residence, 1261 5th Avenue, NY, NY 10029.

MORDEN--Sofia. 83, of Bayside, NY & Palm Springs, CA passed peacefully on May 30, 2013. Born in Kiev, she emigrated to NYC where she devoted her career to women's fashions, fashion designing to co-owning numerous retail stores and manufacturing businesses. She was beloved wife of Jack Morden for 62 years, loving mother to Milla (Les), Alex and Ben (Siobhan), loyal sister to Laura (Boris) and David and doting Grandmother of seven, great-grandmother of three. Dedicated to reuniting her large family from the USSR.

MADELL--Dr. Warren, 91, of Lakewood Ranch, FL, passed away with George and Nancy at his side, Sunday, June 23, 2013, at Sarasota Memorial Hospital. He was born in the Bronx, NY, February 2, 1922. He was predeceased by his wife, Doris Piller Madell. He is survived by his daughter Nancy Turon and son-in-law, George Turon, Lakewood Ranch, FL; his granddaughter, Jennifer Lyn Charles, Larkspur, CA; and his brother, Dr. Harvey Madell, Wellington, FL. A funeral service will be held at Eternal Light Memorial Gardens, 11520 State Road 7, Boynton Beach, on Tuesday, June 25, 2013 at 1:30pm. Dr. Madell graduated from New York University School of Medicine in 1946 and practiced OBGYN in Bay Shore, NY. He was also Chief of Obstetrics at Southside Hospital in Bay Shore. Dr. Madell and his wife Doris retired to The Fountains Country Club in Lake Worth, FL in 1984. He moved to Lakewood Ranch in 2012 to live with his daughter Nancy and his son-in-law, George. He was a kind, generous and wonderful man. He touched the lives of all who knew him in a very special way. He will be greatly missed but will always be in our hearts. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to the American Heart Association.

KAPLAN--Jason. The 92nd Street Y Board and staff mourn with heavy hearts the passing of Jason Kaplan, beloved father of our Chairman, Thomas Kaplan. Our hearts and prayers are with Patricia, Jason's wife, Tom and his wife, Daphne Recanati-Kaplan, their children Orianne, Leonardo and Emmanuel, as well as the entire Kaplan and Recanati families, who have done so much for our community. We have been blessed by their generosity and dedication. May they be comforted among the mourners of Zion and Jerusalem. Stuart J. Ellman, President Sol Adler, Executive Director

KAHN--Ruth, passed away peacefully June 22, 2013 in Tamarac, Florida. Ruth was born in Germany on August 19, 1923. She is now reunited with her husband Ralph. Survived by two children - Renee (Rick), Steven (Carol); four grandchildren- David, Matthew, Amy and Derek; one great-grandchild Mya. She loved life and family.

HOFFELD--Arthur J. Born in Brooklyn, August 30, 1922. Husband of the late Bernice Hoffeld. Father of Jeffrey and the late Steven Hoffeld. Father-in-law of Carol Fein Hoffeld. Grandfather of Noah, Jeremy, and Anna Rose Hoffeld; Samoa Wilson and Ioana Boambes. Great-grandfather of Elona Hoffeld. Beloved Uncle and friend. Graveside service Tuesday, 1:30pm at the New Montefiore Cemetery, West Babylon NY. Donations in his memory may be made to Children's Defense Fund.

GOLDBERG--Gary. A man of incomparable energy, passion, intelligence, enthusiasm and generosity. He greeted people, and life, with a bear hug and a twinkle in his eye. He was as loving as he was loved. The world has lost a giant, and we have lost a dear and adored friend and mentor. We will carry his laugh, and those he inspired in us, with us forever. Our hearts go out to Diana, Shana, Scott, Cailin and Rob. Roy Furman Stephanie & Nicholas Darrow Jill Furman

GANDOLFINI--James. The Mount Sinai Medical Center is deeply saddened by the passing of our dear friend and supporter, James Gandolfini. The generosity of Mr. Gandolfini left an impact on The Mount Sinai Medical Center and the Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai. The Mount Sinai community extends its heartfelt condolences to Mr. Gandolfini's family and friends. Peter W. May, Chairman, Boards of Trustees, The Mount Sinai Medical Center; Kenneth L. Davis, MD, President and CEO, The Mount Sinai Medical Center; Dennis S. Charney, MD, Anne and Joel Ehrenkranz Dean, Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai and Executive Vice President for Academic Affairs at The Mount Sinai Medical Center, and Mary Ann McLaughlin. MD, MPH.
GANDOLFINI--James. The Officers, Governors and Members of the Friars Club deeply mourn the loss of their esteemed member, James Gandolfini. We extend our heartfelt sympathy to his family.

FELDESMAN--Walter. Sterling Bancorp/Sterling National Bank mourn the passing of Walter Feldesman, Esq. and extend our deepest sympathies to his family. He served as our valued director from 1975 to 2008. We will miss his sharp intelligence, warm spirit and wise counsel.
FELDESMAN--Walter, We will always appreciate our special relationship and your guidance as attorney, business advisor, mentor and friend. With love, The Doneger Family

DWIGHT--Murray P. of Wenham, MA and Kennebunk, ME. November 11, 1927-June 22, 2013. Services will be held at St. John's Episcopal Church, Beverly Farms, MA on June 28th at 11am and at St. Ann's Episcopal Church, Kennebunkport, ME on August 12th at 2pm.

BOLLMAN--McWilliam V.,of Bronxville, NY, born in Chicago, IL, March 25, 1930 to Fred and Louise Bollman, beloved husband of Lucy Roesler Bollman, passed away on June 21, 2013. He is survived by his children Mac Jr. (Shelly) of Clifton, VA and Elly Schmidt (Tony) of California, MD, and his four grandchildren. He attended Princeton ('51) and earned his BA from NYU. He was a U.S. Navy pilot from 1950 to 1955 and had a career in international trade. A visitation will be held at McGrath's Funeral Home in Bronxville, NY from 5 to 7pm, June 27. The funeral is at 11:30am, June 30 at Mountain Grove Memorial Church, Huletts Landing, NY. In lieu of flowers, please send donations to Calvary Hospital, 1740 Eastchester Rd., Bronx, NY, 10461 or The Reform Church of Bronxville, PO Box 397, Bronxville, NY, 10708.

BLICKMAN--Joan Magida, of Englewood, NJ, passed away peacefully in her home on June 23. Beloved wife of the late Bruce. Loving mother of Andrea and Ellen and son-in law Rich. Cherished grandmother of Sara and Matthew. Loving sister of Audrey Hyde Zahler and the late Melville Magida. Devoted to her extended family, Marc, Jennifer and Bryan Rubin. She will be remembered for her warmth, her graciousness, her deep caring for others, her strength and her indubitable sense of humor. She will be deeply missed by her family and friends but asked that we remember her with only joy in our hearts. In lieu of flowers, please consider a donation to Bucks County SPCA (www.bcspca.org) or the Flat Rock Brook Nature Center (www.flatrockbrook.org).

BILDNER--Joan Lebson, of Palm Beach Gardens, Florida and West Orange, New Jersey, passed away on June 23, 2013 after a brief illness. Born June 6, 1931 in Englewood, New Jersey, Joan was married for 64 years to Allen Bildner, former Chair and CEO of Kings Super Markets, a family-owned company for 52 years until its 1988 sale to Marks and Spencer. Joan was a long-time leader in the Jewish and secular communities, serving on numerous boards including more recently the Board of Governors of Rutgers University, the Paper Mill Playhouse of Millburn, New Jersey and the Maltz Theatre, Jupiter Florida. She was founding co-chair of the New Jersey/Israel Commission, and co-founder with husband Allen of the Bildner Center for the Study of Jewish Life at Rutgers. Joan received numerous honors and awards recognizing her community service including the Martin Luther King, Jr. Social Justice Lifetime Achievement Award at Dartmouth College, Volunteer of the Year by the National Society of Fundraising Executives, New Jersey, and honorary doctorates from Bloomfield College, Rowan University and Rutgers University. In addition to her devoted husband, Allen, Joan is survived by her loving children, sons Rob and Jim, daughters-in-law Elisa and Nancy, and grandchildren Elana, Lizzie, Ari, Eli and Rafi. She is also survived by her sister, Marion (Milt) Prigoff, and is predeceased by a grandson, Peter. She will be greatly missed by her family, friends and the communities in New Jersey and Florida where she lived, served and played--she was an avid golfer and bridge player. Funeral services will be held at 3 p.m. on Wednesday, June 26th at Temple Sharey Tefilo-Israel, 432 Scotland Rd, South Orange, NJ 07079. In lieu of flowers, the family suggests that donations may be made in her memory to the Paper Mill Playhouse, 22 Brookside Drive, Millburn, NJ 07041, the Maltz Jupiter Theater, 1001 E. Indiantown Rd, Jupiter, FL 33477, and the United States Holocaust Memorial Museum, 100 Raoul Wallenberg Place, SW, Washington, DC 20024.

EPHRON--Nora. "Wasn't it wonderful to have known and loved her? What glory! What fun! What goodness! What loveableness...." Miss you honey xx Diane

WORTMAN--Gisela Laufer, MD, 90, died at home peacefully on June 23. Beloved mother of Marcel (Evelyn) and Albert (Penelope), grandmother of William, Jacob and Benjamin. Devoted sister of Sarah Symchowicz and loving aunt to five nieces and their families. She was a dedicated physician and a spirited, kind and joyous person who will be greatly missed by all who knew her. May her memory be forever a blessing. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to The United States Memorial Holocaust Museum, Washington DC or Columbia University Department of Psychiatry, 1051 Riverside Drive, Unit 98, NY 10032.

WOHLGELERNTER--Maurice 92, died June 22nd. Beloved husband of Esther, father of Debra, Elli, and Beth, father-in-law of Natalie, and devoted grandfather of Dara and Netta. Funeral was held Monday June 24th. May his memory be for a blessing.

WILLIAMS--Basil Jr.,died on June 23rd. Beloved husband of 53 years to Karlene, wonderful father to Basil and Daphne, magical grandfather to Hayden, Kyra, David and Joseph, beloved eldest brother to Robert and Donald, and irreplaceable father-in-law to Heather and George. His family was always first in his life. Whenever you asked Basil how he was, he'd say "100 percent!" and that's how he lived his life. He loved completely and enjoyed every minute of every day. He graduated from Columbia University, earning his BS, MS and MBA. For over 60 years, he was a financial advisor, ultimately at Wells Fargo, winning many awards. He was respected and loved by his clients and colleagues. He worked until the end because he loved what he did. He was a devoted member of the Greek Orthodox Church and very involved with The Cathedral of St. John the Theologian in Tenafly, NJ. He was distinguished and honorable in every aspect of his life, a legacy which will live in his family. Viewing will be held from 4:00-8:00pm on Wednesday at the Barrett Funeral Home in Tenafly, NJ. Funeral services will be held at 11:00am on Thursday at The Cathedral of St. John the Theologian. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to St. Michael's Home for the Aged, 3 Lehman Terrace, Yonkers, NY 10705.

WHITELAW--Dr. Robert Simeon Jr.,66, of Atlanta, GA passed away June 21, 2013 in Highlands, NC. He is survived by his son, Robert Simeon III and wife Michelle of Oxford, AL, his son, John Christopher and wife Sofia of Long Island City, NY, his son, Benjamin Anderson of Chattanooga, TN, grandchildren Mary, Peyton, Robert, Julia and Francisco as well as his siblings Jim and Jean. A loving father and grandfather, his grandchildren affectionately knew him as "Gramps". Services will be held at Sosebee Funeral Home in Canton, GA. sosebeefuneralhome.com

STRAUSS--Bernice Lila (Ginsberg), 82, devoted wife of Kenneth Strauss, loving mother of Beth Zelin (son-in-law Barry Zelin) and Dr. Nancy Strauss (son-in-law Scott Altabet). Adoring grandmother of Amy, Jake, Jason and Daniel. Loved by her family and many lifelong friends. Longtime resident of Yonkers, known for her kindness, generosity, thoughtfulness, optimism. She will be dearly missed. Funeral: Thursday, June 27th at 12 noon, Weinstein Memorial Chapel, 1652 Central Park Ave, Yonkers, NY. Donations can be made to Columbia University Department of Rehabilitation and Regenerative Medicine, Office of Development, 100 Haven Avenue, Suite 29D, New York, NY 10032 or select Stem Cell Initiative at: https://giving.columbia.edu/ giveonline/

SKOLNICK--Holly. The attorneys and staff of Greenberg Traurig mourn the loss of Holly, a beloved colleague, talented lawyer, mentor and friend in the Miami office. A native New Yorker, Skolnick, chaired the firm's Pro Bono initiative and was President/ Founder of the Greenberg Traurig Fellowship Foundation. Her amazing drive for justice and passion for giving back to our communities made her stand out. We extend our deepest sympathy to her family. Donations can be made in Skolnick's name to Americans for Immigrant Justice in Miami.
SHARIN--Hilda, 99. Died June 17, 2013. Beloved for her warmth, energy, intelligence. Her exuberant spirit lives!

SHALLY--George (Shushie), died peacefully on June 25, 2013, surrounded by his loving family. A native New Yorker, he served in combat during WWII, attended UC Berkeley and graduated from NYU. In a long career with the forest products industry, George served as a Vice President of Crown Zellerbach. Shush lived life to the fullest. A builder, gardener, king of logistics and master of all ceremonies, world traveler, sculptor, lover of ballet and classical music, feminist, mentor and business entrepreneur, he loved his friends and he loved his family, he loved to laugh and he made everyone laugh with him. He was happiest when celebrating with family and friends. Shush is survived by his beloved wife of 64 years, Connie, their children, Lise Elkind and her husband Tom, Jobie LaBelle and her husband Dan, Betsy Shally Jensen and her husband Mike, Peter Dunham and his wife Sharon, eight grandchildren: Jaime, Daniel, Jake, Julie, Sara, Greg, Lilia and Shaya; and great grandson Kleine Ronnie. Donations can be made to the Alzheimers Association.

ROSENBLATT--Joseph. Urban Pathways notes with sorrow the passing of Joe Rosenblatt, husband of former Board member Sheila Rosenblatt. Joe was a friend of Urban Pathways and a supporter of the drive to end homelessness. We extend condolences to Sheila and her family.

O'ROURKE--Catherine Marie, age 96. After a brief illness, of heart failure, on June 23, 2013. Born Catherine Marie Burchie, March 8, 1917, on Staten Island. In 1947, married Charles O'Rourke, who served with the NYPD for over 20 years. Her husband predeceased her in 1992. Moved to Stuyvesant Town in Manhattan as a bride in 1948, where she lived until 2004, when she moved to Lott Assisted Living Residence at 108th and 5th Ave. Survived by her son, Terrence J. O'Rourke, and her daughter-in-law, Melinda Roberts O'Rourke, of New York City and Sewickley Heights, PA. Also survived by her niece, Dr. Barbara Naiman Young of Philadelphia and her nephew, Deacon Donald Naiman of Danbury, CT. Service on Wednesday, June 26. Calling at 10am, Funeral Service at 11am at Andrett Funeral Home, 353 Second Ave., between 20th and 21st, NYC, 212-475-2024. Memorial donations to Lott Assisted Living Residence, 1261 5th Avenue, NY, NY 10029.

KLEIMAN--Daniel Michael, 37, beloved son, husband and father, died June 23, 2013 of cancer with his family and dear friends at his bedside. Dan was the son of Jay H. Kleiman, M.D. and Judith O. Kleiman, stepson of Georgianna E. Kleiman. Dan's wife, Tatiana (Lomakina) Kleiman, mother of his three children, Marina Kalinina, Evan Morton, and Esther Vivian, are joined by his sister, Irit Ruth Kleiman (Roberto Rey-Agudo), and niece Beatriz, step-brothers and sister, Michael Edwards, Maureen E. Hanson (Gregg), Brian Edwards (Kathy) and Terence Edwards, and five nieces and nephews. Services will be held at Temple Shalom, 300 E. Putnam, Avenue, Greenwich, CT. Thursday June 27 at 9:30am. All are invited to attend. A second Memorial service will be held in Chicago on Monday, July 1, 10:00am at Weinstein Funeral Home 111 North Skokie Blvd., Skokie, IL. In lieu of flowers, contributions may be made to a cancer research fund established in Dan's memory at Memorial Sloan Kettering, NYC, which can be accessed through: http://tinyurl.com/ kblaqua

KAPLAN--Jason. UJA-Federation of New York mourns with sadness the passing of Jason Kaplan, father of Thomas Kaplan. We extend our heartfelt condolences to Jason's wife, Patricia; Thomas and his wife, Daphne; their children; and the entire family. Jerry W. Levin, President; Alisa R. Doctoroff, Chair of the Board; John S. Ruskay, Exec. VP & CEO

KAHN--Ruth, passed away peacefully June 22, 2013 in Tamarac, Florida. Ruth was born in Germany on August 19, 1923. She is now reunited with her husband Ralph. Survived by two children - Renee (Rick), Steven (Carol); four grandchildren- David, Matthew, Amy and Derek; one great-grandchild Mya. She loved life and family.

GOLDBERG--Gary. A man of incomparable energy, passion, intelligence, enthusiasm and generosity. He greeted people, and life, with a bear hug and a twinkle in his eye. He was as loving as he was loved. The world has lost a giant, and we have lost a dear and adored friend and mentor. We will carry his laugh, and those he inspired in us, with us forever. Our hearts go out to Diana, Shana, Scott, Cailin and Rob. Roy Furman Stephanie & Nicholas Darrow Jill Furman

FISCHEL--Edward Elliot, MD, ScD Med. Beloved husband of the late Pauline, cherished father of Robert and Janet, loving father-in-law of Shelley Fischel and Russ Whitehurst. Devoted brother of the late Leon, (the late Elaine) and of Daniel (Maxine). Dear grandfather of Joseph (Igor), Owen (Anita), Eliana, and Adam. Former Chief of Staff at the Northport V.A. and previously Chief of Medicine at Sinai Hospital, Hartford and the Bronx-Lebanon Hospital, New York. He was highly regarded and frequently honored for the seminal research contributions he made to rheumatology. Services: Thursday, 12:30pm at I.J. Morris, 21 E. Deer Park Road, Dix Hills/Huntington Station, NY. In lieu of flowers, please make donations to the charity of your choice.
FELDESMAN--Walter, We will always appreciate our special relationship and your guidance as attorney, business advisor, mentor and friend. With love, The Doneger Family

EPSTEIN--Tillie. Born Tillie Schwartz on November 1, 1920. Passed on June 24, 2013 at the youthful age of 92. Affectionate, dedicated mother to Phillip, Nathaniel, and Joseph. Loving wife to Sol. Vibrant grandmother to Cheryl, Melissa, Samantha, and Benjamin. Beloved sister to Rose and Stanley. Compassionate aunt to Rita, Bernard, Harriet, Martha, Leonard, Joe, and Michael. She was a teacher, an artist, a caretaker, and a master bridge player. The most unbelievable person we will ever know. She touched the life of every person she crossed paths with, no matter how fleetingly. She loved everything about life. She will be genuinely missed.

DWIGHT--Murray P. of Wenham, MA and Kennebunk, ME. November 11, 1927-June 22, 2013. Services will be held at St. John's Episcopal Church, Beverly Farms, MA on June 28th at 11am and at St. Ann's Episcopal Church, Kennebunkport, ME on August 12th at 2pm.

BLACK--Dwight P.,"Whitey" 82, of Vero Beach, FL, died June 24, 2013 at his home. He was born in Bronxville, NY. He had been a resident of Vero Beach for 18 years and was previously a resident of Grosse Pointe, MI and Opelika, AL. Mr. Black received his Bachelor of Science degree from Harvard University and later received his MBA from Harvard Business School. Mr. Black retired after 33 years of service for Uniroyal and Michelin Tire Cos. He held a variety of Director-Level positions during his tenure. Survivors include his wife of 59 years, Ann-Elisa W. Black; son, Dr. Donald R. (Wanda) Black; daughters, Elizabeth D. Black and Pamela P. Black and five grandchildren. Online condolences may be sent at www.coxgiffordseawinds.com.

Bildner--Joan. The United States Holocaust Memorial Museum mourns the passing of Joan Lebson Bildner. The Bildner family was among the Museum's earliest supporters, helping to build this institution and playing an active role in its growth. We will always remember Joan for her commitment to Holocaust education and for her dynamism and determination. Our sincere condolences go to her husband, Allen, her sons, Rob and Jim, her daughters-in-law, Elisa and Nancy, and the entire Bildner family.

BARKAS--Arthur, 94, died peacefully June 24, 2013. We treasure our memories and feel privileged to have had this very special man with an extraordinary heart in our lives. His 71+ year marriage to beloved wife, Grace, was one of deep love and devotion. Born in Brooklyn, formerly of Franklin Square, NY/Boca Raton. Proud WWII vet, practicing attorney at Puritan Lighting; a founder of JCC of W. Hempstead. Cherished father to Daryl, adoring Papa to Jana. A bright light has gone out.

LAGEY--Dr. Joseph C. June 27, 1913 March 21, 1978 In loving memory of our Dad and in happy celebration of the 100th anniversary of his birth. From his children, Barbara Lagey Geer and Christopher Lagey. We still miss him.
EDELMAN--Morton H. Our guide and inspiration. Deeply missed, forever loved. Diana and Alex

WORTMAN--Gisela Laufer, MD, 90, died at home peacefully on June 23. Beloved mother of Marcel (Evelyn) and Albert (Penelope), grandmother of William, Jacob and Benjamin. Devoted sister of Sarah Symchowicz and loving aunt to five nieces and their families. She was a dedicated physician and a spirited, kind and joyous person who will be greatly missed by all who knew her. May her memory be forever a blessing. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to The United States Memorial Holocaust Museum, Washington DC or Columbia University Department of Psychiatry, 1051 Riverside Drive, Unit 98, NY 10032.

WOHLGELERNTER--Maurice The Board of Trustees and staff of the Jewish Communal Fund mourn with sorrow the passing of Maurice Wohlgelernter, father of our esteemed colleague, Beth. Rabbi Wohlgelernter was a teacher and scholar and deeply devoted to his family. May his wife Esther and children Beth, Debra, Elli (Natalie) and grandchildren, Dara and Netta, be comforted among the mourners of Zion and Jerusalem. May his memory be a blessing and an inspiration. Karen Adler, President Sue Dickman, Executive Vice President

WHITELAW--Dr. Robert Simeon Jr.,66, of Atlanta, GA passed away June 21, 2013 in Highlands, NC. He is survived by his son, Robert Simeon III and wife Michelle of Oxford, AL, his son, John Christopher and wife Sofia of Long Island City, NY, his son, Benjamin Anderson of Chattanooga, TN, grandchildren Mary, Peyton, Robert, Julia and Francisco as well as his siblings Jim and Jean. A loving father and grandfather, his grandchildren affectionately knew him as "Gramps". Services will be held at Sosebee Funeral Home in Canton, GA. sosebeefuneralhome.com

STERN--Bert, on June 26, 2013. Beloved husband of Shannah Laumeister. Devoted father of Trista Stern Wright, Susannah Stern and Bret Stern. Loving brother of Dianne Schlanger and the late Sheldon Stern. Cherished grandfather of Miranda, Georgia and Shane. Funeral services will be held Friday 11:30am at Frank E. Campbell Funeral Home, 1076 Madison Ave. (at 81st St.).

RAUCCI--Domenica. Died peacefully at home in New York City on June 25, one month before her 88th birthday. Born on July 26, 1925, in Gallo, Italy. Known to all as "Min." She was truly a special lady - smart and vivacious, quick-witted, and a wonderful grandmother. She was loved by all. Min is survived by her husband Pete, sister Anna Ronga, sons Robert and Richard, and grandchildren Tarek, Omar, Faris, Keith and Jaime.

POMERANTZ--Arthur David. January 31, 1927-June 23, 2013. Arthur Pomerantz, 86, peacefully passed away after a courageous battle with illness. He is lovingly remembered by his devoted partner Joan Caccavelli, two daughters, Fran and Amy Pomerantz, and his former wife and dear friend Sandy Pomerantz. His warm heart and sharp wit engaged the affection of countless others that were fortunate enough to know him. Arthur had that rare persona that made you feel very special. With a wink and his kind smile he would win your heart. His genuine kindness overshadowed his human frailties. He is dearly loved and deeply missed by so many that crossed his path. Thank you Arthur for all the wonderful memories we will never let go of.

MADDEN--Sydelle. Steven Madden LTD mourns the loss of Sydelle Madden, mother of our founder, Steve and Board Member, John. Our sincere condolences to Steve and Wendy, John and Sherrie, Luke, and the entire Madden family. Our thoughts and prayers are with you all at this time.

MANDELBAUM--Laurence Howard, was born in Brooklyn, NY on December 7, 1949. As a child his family moved to Kearny, New Jersey, and in the process relocated their small clothing store, Mandee Shops. Not long after graduating from law school, Larry joined his father and two uncles in the business and managed the business as it expanded from five shops in New Jersey downtown central business districts to nearly 200 locations in nine states. Larry served as President and CEO of Mandee Shops and Annie Sez stores from the mid-1980's through 1999. Larry had a tremendous amount of foresight. If he wasn't sure what was around the corner, he would find the right people to advise him. He was persistent but kind. He treated everyone who worked with and for him as an equal. And if he saw injustice, if he thought of a way to mitigate someone else's trouble he would move mountains to help if he could. Larry received his JD from New York Law School and is a graduate of American University in Washington DC. Larry was predeceased by his parents Max and Pearl (Flax) Mandelbaum. He is survived by his wife of 41 years Karen Grundfest Mandelbaum and his sons Daniel and Andrew, daughter-in-law Hind Kabaj, his brother Alan and wife Barbara, and sister Susan. Larry is also mourned many devoted in-laws, cousins, nieces, nephews, and friends. Donations in Larry's name can be made to the following organizations: Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center. Please make checks to MSKCC/Dr. Howard Scher in memory of Laurence H. Mandelbaum. Address: Dr. Howard Scher 353 East 68th St. New York, NY 10065. Montclair Art Museum. Please make checks to the Montclair Art Museum in memory of Laurence H. Mandelbaum. Donations will be used for educational programming. Address: Montclair Art Museum 3 South Mountain Avenue. Montclair, NJ 07042

MADDEN--Sydelle Lewy. "We thought she was going to live forever." Our mom passed away on June 25th: ninety years old, eight grandchildren. Daughter of Sidney and Helen from Far Rockaway, sister of Lolly, happily married for fifty years to Jack Madden of the Five Towns. She was a Veteran of World War II, loved her country and her family. Everybody loved Sitchie. Bye Mom, John, Luke, and Steve.

LUTZ--Jean, 99, died peacefully June 23, 2013. Beloved teacher (Ethical Culture & Fox Meadow), who communicated to generations of students and to countless friends an extraordinary love and enthusiasm for life and interest in all things. Douglas Durst Vicki Aranow Feiner Liz Guggenheimer Mel Hertzig Rick Glickstein Eileen Kaufman Annette Marcus Richard Marks Neil Ross Steve Schreiber Louis Thalheimer Nina Totenberg
LUTZ--Jean A.,teacher at Brooklyn Ethical Culture School and Fox Meadow in Scarsdale.

KUPFERMAN--Susan. The Rudin Center for Transportation at NYU's Wagner School of Public Service notes with sorrow the passing of Susan Kupferman, the first Co-Director of the Rudin Center. Susan's energy and intelligence made her a joy to work with. Our condolences to her family. Mitchell L. Moss, Director, Rudin Center for Transportation, New York University

KIDERMAN--Boris. With profound sadness we mourn the passing of our esteemed national vice president and friend, Boris Kiderman. Active in Bnai Zion for more than 30 years, Boris was a dedicated, enthusiastic officer of our organization who helped establish the Russian Division and raise hundreds of thousands of dollars for our projects. Boris supported Israel with fierce determination and lively spirit and will be remembered for his tireless devotion, humility and kindness. May his family be comforted among the mourners of Zion and Jerusalem. Bnai Zion Foundation David H. Eisenberg, President, George W. Schaeffer, Chairman of the Board, Jack Grunspan, Executive Vice President, Mel Parness, Executive Vice President Emeritus, Raymond M. Patt, Honorary Chair

HEYMAN--Richard Simon, 87. Died June 25, 2013. Attorney born in, and proudly practiced his entire career in the Bronx ("El Abogado"). Served in the Third Fleet, US Navy, World War II. NYU Law School (courtesy of the GI Bill). Husband to Sulamita Szarf Heyman (died 2007). Father of Paul Heyman, and Grandfather of Azalea and Jacob Heyman of Scarsdale (Edgemont), New York. Uncle to Laurie (Gerardo) Pina, Wendy (Wayne) Zeilner and Mitchell (Joan/Alyssa/Kevin) Norwin. His knowledge, intelligence, street smarts, sense of humor, kindness, ethics, loyalty and sage wisdom enriched all those around him. There are no adjectives posted here, for no description could ever do this man justice. His grandchildren will one day tell their children about "Papu," and they will do so with great pride. Don't mourn this death. He got more out of life than a kid from the Depression could ever dream imaginable. Services Friday, June 28 at Noon at The Weinstein Memorial, 1652 Central Park Avenue, Yonkers, NY 10710, (914)793-3800

GOGGINS--Kathryn Lurlane. A longtime resident of Brooklyn Heights, passed away on June 25, 2013 after a brief illness. The daughter of Luchion and Beulah Goggins of Charleston, SC., she is survived by two brothers, Albert and Donald, and many nieces and nephews. She was a graduate of Avery Institute and Benedict College. She retired from the NYC school system. Services by Joseph G. Duffy FH. Mass will be at St. Thomas Aquinas at 9:30am on June 29th with interment at Calvary Cemetery. In lieu of flowers, donations may be made to the Lupus Foundation.

CUSACK--Philip. Died June 12, 2013. Broadway and television director, stage manager and performer. Memorial Saturday June 29 at 2:30pm, Church of the Transfiguration (1 E. 29 Street). Donations to the Episcopal Actors' Guild.

CASSIDY--John Francis Kevin formerly of Stamford and Old Greenwich, CT, died on June 23, 2013 in Sonoma, CA. Husband to Patricia Crawford Cassidy of Sonoma, CA. Father to Anne Cassidy of Sonoma, CA, Sarah Cassidy of Duvall, WA, and John Cassidy of Westfield, NJ. Father-in-law of Sam Turner, Luke Woodward and Rebecca Kelly. Grandfather of Grace, Jack, Alice, Pearl, Lily and Maggie. Brother to Efford and Edward Cassidy and the late Elizabeth Krauss, Margaret Chaisson, Nancy Grogan, and James Cassidy. Officer in the US Navy during the Korean War. Graduate of Bronx's All Hallow's School, Manhattan College, and Cornell Law School. A gentle and up-right man, Jack was beloved by all who knew him. Services will be held in Sonoma, CA on June 29th and Old Greenwich, CT on August 17th. In lieu of flowers or gifts, please donate to The Catholic Charities of Fairfield County: https:/cfairfield.org/index.php/donate

CANTOR--Paul. The Board of Directors and staff of Selfhelp Community Services are deeply saddened by the passing of Paul Cantor, beloved father of Board Vice President, Matthew A. Cantor. Our heartfelt condolences are extended to his devoted wife, Lillian; children, Mitchell (Marla), Jodi (Michael) and Matthew (Kimberly), and his loving grandchildren. May warm memories be of comfort to you during this difficult time and may his memory be for a blessing. Raymond V.J. Schrag, President Stuart C. Kaplan, CEO
BERNSTEIN--Adam. We are deeply grieved by the loss of our dear Adam. He will never leave us. The memory of his kind and gentle soul will live forever in our hearts. Alice, Stuart, Elyse and Neil

BARKAS--Arthur, 94, died peacefully June 24, 2013. We treasure our memories and feel privileged to have had this very special man with an extraordinary heart in our lives. His 71+ year marriage to beloved wife, Grace, was one of deep love and devotion. Born in Brooklyn, formerly of Franklin Square, NY/Boca Raton. Proud WWII vet, practicing attorney at Puritan Lighting; a founder of JCC of W. Hempstead. Cherished father to Daryl, adoring Papa to Jana. A bright light has gone out.

AZARIA--Albert, was born in Harlem, NY 86 years ago. He was a resident of North Miami, FL for the past 35 years, formerly of Queens, NY. Mr. Azaria passed away on June 25, 2013 in his home. He attended one year of college at F.I.T. and he served our country in the Air Force from 1945-1946. Mr. Azaria was a dress manufacturer and the owner of the following companies, Sherwood Fashions, Samuel Scott, Simon Sez and A1Azaria, Inc. He was also a member of Alzheimer's Notables and the Sephardic Jewish Brotherhood. He will be deeply missed by his beloved wife Ruth Azaria (Altchek) for the past 62 years. He was a loving father of Stephanie Azaria, Elise Azaria and Hank (Katie) Azaria, cherished grandfather of Amanda Lane, Ethan Von Lindern, Molly Von Lindern and Hal Azaria. Chapel service on Friday June 28, 2011 12:00pm at Levitt-Weinstein 18840 W. Dixie Highway North Miami Beach, FL 33180, interment to follow at Menorah Gardens in Southwest Ranches. Contributions in his memory may be made to Season's Hospice 5200 NE 2nd Ave., Miami, FL 33137.

STEINHARDT--Minna, 89, mother of Phillip and Louis, grandma of Casey, Andrew, Mike and Jay, mother-in-law to Diane and Na. Funeral, New Montefiore, Farmingdale, NY, June 30 at 1pm.

ROTHENBERG--Barbara, 80, beloved wife of the late Abraham, devoted mother of David and Daniel, generous and caring friend; accomplished artist, inspirational teacher, creative spirit. Funeral: June 30, 10am, A. Green Funeral Home, Fairfield, CT.

REVZIN--Liane J, on June 26, 2013. As beautiful on the inside as she was on the outside. Liane was a smart, funny, gentle soul who always had a kind work or moment for anyone. Dear long-time companion of Joe LaRosa, beloved sister of Fern Revzin, she will also be missed by her "posse," her large circle of devoted friends. Service Sunday, June 30, 2013, 11:30am, Frank E. Campbell The Funeral Chapel, Madison Avenue at 81 St. Donations in her memory may be made to Be The Match Foundation, www.marrow.org .

ROGERS--David, Tony nominated playwright, television writer, author of five novels, 45 plays and musicals, and winner of Prix D'Italia, dies at 85. Acting on radio as a child on The Rainbow Hour, he did his first Broadway Play at 17. He went on to write six Broadway plays, three in London's West End, The Jackie Gleason Show, The Carol Burnett Show, and Charlie & Algernon on Broadway. In the 1980s he was back on Broadway acting in Doubles, Broadway, A Funny Thing Happened On the Way To the Forum and starring in countless plays regionally while touring his own one man show Naked On Broadway. Recently he helped new writers and actors learn their craft at The Theatre Artists Workshop of Westport and sat on the board of Westport's Art Commission. He is survived by his wife of 50 years June Walker Rogers, daughters Dulcy and Amanda and four adoring grandchildren.

RAUCCI--Domenica. Died peacefully at home in New York City on June 25, one month before her 88th birthday. Born on July 26, 1925, in Gallo, Italy. Known to all as "Min." She was truly a special lady - smart and vivacious, quick-witted, and a wonderful grandmother. She was loved by all. Min is survived by her husband Pete, sister Anna Ronga, sons Robert and Richard, and grandchildren Tarek, Omar, Faris, Keith and Jaime.
RAFALE--Milton Jason. It is with deep sorrow that we announce the death Milton Jason Rafale. He will be greatly missed by his close friends and family.

MADDEN--Sydelle. Steven Madden LTD mourns the loss of Sydelle Madden, mother of our founder, Steve and Board Member, John. Our sincere condolences to Steve and Wendy, John and Sherrie, Luke, and the entire Madden family. Our thoughts and prayers are with you all at this time.
MADDEN--Sydelle. Our deepest sympathies to Steve and John Madden and their family on the passing of their beloved mother Sydelle. Seymour and Edward Ubell

KUPFERMAN--Susan. The Rudin Center for Transportation at NYU's Wagner School of Public Service notes with sorrow the passing of Susan Kupferman, the first Co-Director of the Rudin Center. Susan's energy and intelligence made her a joy to work with. Our condolences to her family. Mitchell L. Moss, Director, Rudin Center for Transportation, New York University

KAHN--William. UJA-Federation of New York mourns with sadness the passing of William Kahn, former executive vice president of the Federation of Jewish Philanthropies whose lifelong career of Jewish service helped enrich the lives of countless people and strengthen the Jewish community. As the executive vice president of the Federation of Jewish Philanthropies, he was instrumental in moving the United Jewish Appeal and Federation towards the merger that created UJA-Federation of New York. We extend our condolences to his children, Michael, Jane, Debi, and Julie, and the entire Kahn family. Jerry W. Levin, President; Alisa R. Doctoroff, Chair of the Board; John S. Ruskay, Exec. VP & CEO

JACKSON--Leslie Gillette, nee Elizabeth Mann Gillette, March 14, 1921-May 22, 2013, painter and poet. Her's is a profound art of the "mind of the eyes of the imagination." Everlastingly beautiful and beloved, she will be ever remembered by her husband, Robert Louis Jackson; daughters Emily Robin and Kathy; grandchildren Emily, Jesse, Ella, Jackson, and Sumaia; and all who knew her. "A Celebration of her Life: Leslie Gillette Jackson" will take place at Truro Center for the Arts at Castle Hill, Truro, MA 02666, Saturday, August 3, 2013, between 2 and 4 pm.

HEYMAN--Richard Simon, 87. Died June 25, 2013. Attorney born, and proudly practiced his entire career in the Bronx ("El Abogado"). Served in the Third Fleet, US Navy, World War II. NYU Law School (courtesy of the GI Bill). Husband to Sulamita Szarf Heyman (died 2009). Father of Paul Heyman, and Grandfather of Azalea and Jacob Heyman of Scarsdale (Edgemont), New York. Uncle to Laurie (Gerardo) Pina, Wendy (Wayne) Zeilner and Mitchell (Joan/Alyssa/Kevin) Norwin. His knowledge, intelligence, street smarts, sense of humor, kindness, ethics, loyalty and sage wisdom enriched all those around him. There are no adjectives posted here, for no description could ever do this man justice. His grandchildren will one day tell their children about "Papu," and they will do so with great pride. Don't mourn this death. He got more out of life than a kid from the Depression could ever dream imaginable. Services Friday, June 28 at Noon at The Weinstein Memorial, 1652 Central Park Avenue, Yonkers, NY 10710, (914)793-3800

GERSTEIN--Irving. High Ridge Country Club acknowledges with sorrow the passing of our esteemed member, Irving Gerstein. We extend our deepest sympathy to his beloved wife, Muriel, and their family. Stuart Albrecht, President Robert D. Lang, Secretary

GERSTEIN--Irving V.,94 years old, of Palm Beach FL, formerly of New York City, passed away on June 25, 2013. He is survived by: his wife of 71 years, Muriel; his daughter, Nanci; his son-in-law, Robert Schwartz; his grandsons Jonathan and Daniel and his granddaughter-in-law Karen Ahrens. He was born in New York City on VE Day, November 11, 1918. He graduated from Dewitt Clinton High School and attended New York University where he later taught graduate level classes. He served in the Pacific Theater in World War II, rising to Army Air Corps Captain. He, and other family members, grew their fathers' rug and weather strip business into Thermwell Products Co., Inc., a 100 year old, three generation concern that employs hundreds. A champion golf and tennis player, he was a past member of Fresh Meadow Country Club in New York and a member of High Ridge Country Club in Florida. Philanthropy was a major part of his busy life. Among the charities he supported are: North Shore Hospital, UJA, Israel Guide Dogs Foundation, and various breast cancer charities, including the Beth Tortolani Breast Cancer Foundation who, a few years ago honored him as man of the year. Irving always spoke with frankness and sincerity and was quick to work a pun or a joke into any conversation. He was a father figure to those close to him, an advisor to many and generous (almost) to a fault. The family asks that contributions in Irv's memory be made in honor of his grandson being a 10 year survivor to the Leukemia & Lymphoma Society: www.lls.org or 1311 Mamaroneck Avenue, Suite 310, White Plains, NY 10605. Phone 914-949-5213; fax 914-949-6691

GENKIN--Stephen. The Board of Governors and the Members of The Seawane Club record with sorrow the loss of our member Stephen Genkin. We extend heartfelt sympathy to his wife Phyllis and family. Jack Irushalmi, President

GENKIN--I. Stephen, 92, died on June 26, 2013. Husband of Phyllis and the late Rhoda. Father of Jonathan (Samantha) and Cathy (Barton) Leftin. Grandfather of Avi, Ben (Shil) and Reuben. Graveside services private.

DARBY--Susan. Temple Beth El of Cedarhurst mourns the passing of our longtime member Susan Darby. We extend condolences to her husband Joel, children Pamela and Alan and the entire Darby family. Sholom Stern Rabbi Richard Holland President

CHAMI--Andree, 63 years old. Beloved daughter of the late Jean and Marie Chami, devoted sister, and cherished aunt. A dedicated and conscientious executive administrator in human resources , she worked at The United Nations for over thirty years. Andree was full of life and a world traveler, a lover of fine food and wine, an elegant dresser, devoted to staying fit, an avid opera and theatergoer, and a quintessential New Yorker. When attending the movies, which she often liked to do, she never failed to order a big bag of popcorn and a Diet Coke. She will be deeply missed by all who knew and loved her. Friends may call Sunday, June 30, 2013 at Frank E. Campbell, 1076 Madison Avenue, NYC 2-5pm and 7-9pm. Mass of Christian Burial Monday, July 1, 9:30am at St. Vincent Ferrer Church, Lexington Ave at 66 St, NYC.

CUSACK--Philip. Died June 12, 2013. Broadway and television director, stage manager and performer. Memorial Saturday June 29 at 2:30pm, Church of the Transfiguration (1 E. 29 Street). Donations to the Episcopal Actors' Guild.

CASSIDY--John Francis Kevin formerly of Stamford and Old Greenwich, CT, died on June 23, 2013 in Sonoma, CA. Husband to Patricia Crawford Cassidy of Sonoma, CA. Father to Anne Cassidy of Sonoma, CA, Sarah Cassidy of Duvall, WA, and John Cassidy of Westfield, NJ. Father-in-law of Sam Turner, Luke Woodward and Rebecca Kelly. Grandfather of Grace, Jack, Alice, Pearl, Lily and Maggie. Brother to Efford and Edward Cassidy and the late Elizabeth Krauss, Margaret Chaisson, Nancy Grogan, and James Cassidy. Officer in the US Navy during the Korean War. Graduate of Bronx's All Hallow's School, Manhattan College, and Cornell Law School. A gentle and up-right man, Jack was beloved by all who knew him. Services will be held in Sonoma, CA on June 29th and Old Greenwich, CT on August 17th. In lieu of flowers or gifts, please donate to The Catholic Charities of Fairfield County: https:/cfairfield.org/index.php/donate

BILDNER--Joan. The New Jersey Performing Arts Center expresses deep sorrow over the passing of longtime arts, education, and human rights philanthropist Joan Bildner, wife and mother, respectively, of Board Members Allen and James Bildner. The vision she shared with her husband, to bring the joy of the performing arts to individuals of limited means, resulted in the founding of NJPAC's Ticket Subsidy Fund in 1997. Their generosity has enabled thousands to experience live performance for the first time. We extend our condolences to the entire Bildner family. William J. Marino, Chair, Board of Directors, and John Schreiber, President and CEO.

AXELROD--Martin, 81, a man of compassion and integrity, passed away on June 26, 2013 in Boca Raton, FL. He was born in Brooklyn, NY and graduated from the NYU School of Engineering and received his Masters in Engineering from Columbia University. He was one of the pioneers in technology both in research and business leadership roles; first at IBM where he was Vice President of the Computer Division then at Harris Corporation's Computer division where he assumed a GM role prior to retiring. He dedicated his life to his family and those around him and never stopped learning and giving. Martin will be missed by many including Cecile, his loving wife of 56 years; his children Susan, Lisa and Steven; his sons-in-law George and Aaron; four grandchildren and his brother Elliot.

TALBOT--Donald. 20 years Today. Roslyn and James
DREXLER--Rachel. May 22, 1947 - January 29, 2010. Dearest, we miss you always, love. Mother, father & brother

CHAO--Howard Hao Sheng. 11/29/20 - 6/29/12. Not a day goes by without me thinking of you and missing you so much. Thank you for our 60 years of life together. I met you when I was so young, and you were a foreign correspondent in Japan. Your keen sense of humor, insightful view of the world, and vast knowledge of Chinese poetry never failed to fascinate me. Above all, you loved me so deeply, and guided me and opened up an entirely new world for me. My heart is full of gratitude to you forever. Chie

VAN TELL--Terry. Beloved life partner of Gilbert Gabriel, on June 27. Educated at Vassar and Juilliard, her career was as varied as it was exceptional: concert pianist, film actor and producer. Numerous appearances on radio and TV soaps, heard extensively on radio commercials and TV voice-overs, and finally, as CEO of Terry Van Tell & Associates, a media training organization. Her vitality, humor and generosity will be sorely missed by all who knew and loved her. Also survived by Bert Nelson and other loving cousins. Funeral service 11:30am, Monday, July 1 at Frank E. Campbell Memorial Chapel, 1076 Madison Ave. at 81st Street. In lieu of flowers, donations to the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society, 475 Park Avenue South, New York, NY 10016 would be appreciated.

McKENNA--Theresa. With deep sorrow, Hudson Guild announces the untimely death of our colleague and friend, Theresa McKenna. As Director of Development and External Relations, Theresa made a tremendous mark on Hudson Guild. She lead the effort to rebuild the Guild's fundraising operation and dramatically increased support for our essential social and human services programs. Beyond her substantial skill and ability, Theresa embodied the joy, optimism and sense of possibility that exists at the Guild. She clearly relished her interactions with the children, teens and adults in our programs, and was as invested in the people at the Guild as she was in her job. Theresa was creative, tenacious and resourceful, and was forthright and reliable. Importantly, she was also always quick with a laugh. All of us at Hudson Guild are stunned by this news, and Theresa will truly be missed here. We share our sorrow with all those who loved Theresa, and whom she loved. Viewing is Sunday, June 30, 4-7pm, Riverside Memorial Chapel, Funeral Mass is Monday, July 1, 10am, Church of the Blessed Sacrament. Community Gathering, directly following funeral, at Hudson Guild. Family has indicated that, in lieu of flowers, donations may be made to Hudson Guild.

LINDER--Bert. The community of West End Synagogue, A Reconstructionist Congregation, is stricken by the news of Bert's sudden death. A founder and shaper of our shul, he became one of its dependables. It is very painful to know we will never again have his ever available wise counsel, nor the aura of humor and good cheer that sheltered us all impartially. He was both a mensche and a true alpha male. Our endless love and support to his beloved wife Bliss and to Ellen, Steve, Rebecca and Adira and their families.

GREENFELD--Sandra. January 1, 1926-June 27, 2013. The life of the party. Survived by husband, Dr. Harry Garbus, children Dale Greenfeld (Patrick Cunningham) Henry Greenfeld (Melea) and grandchildren Hannah and Ashley. Predeceased by loving husband and father, Aaron Greenfeld. Service Sunday, June 30, 11:30am, Boulevard-Riverside-Hewlett Chapel, Hewlett, NY.

FIELDS--Janet, 54, courageous and beloved daughter of Suzanne and Stephen Fields, adored sister of Nancy and Jon Bauer and Ken and Maria Fields and loving aunt of Jeff and Laura Bauer, Sarah, Haley, and Greig Fields. Funeral Service 11am Sunday, June 30, 2013 at Zion Memorial Chapel, 785 East Boston Post Road, Mamaroneck, NY 10543. 914-381-1809.

CONNELLY--Thomas Maurice, III born September 16th, 1930 died peacefully on Nantucket, June 23, 2013. He was born in New York City, the son of Alice Craven Connelly Mara and Thomas M. Connelly, II. He attended All Hallows High School and the Taft School. He graduated from Yale College in 1952 and from Harvard Business School in 1957. He served in the US Army from 1953-1955. He was married to Fanny Alice Martin in 1954. The marriage ended in 1975. He married Margret Ward in 1982 who passed away in 2006. He is survived by his loving companion, Cam Dutton, his four children, their spouses and his seven grandchildren. Contributions can be made to Palliative & Supportive Care of Nantucket.

ACKLEY--James F.,passed away Wednesday, June 26th at NY-Presbyterian Weill Cornell Hospital, at age 84. He was the beloved husband of 39 years to Diane Ackley, a consultant at The Estee Lauder Companies. Survived by loving daughters Rachel Ackley Borek (Andrew), Judy Ackley Brown (Martin), Susan Ackley Lukens (Jay Lukens deceased), and Ruth Carol Ackley. Also survived by grandchildren Clinton Lukens (Rachel), Ashley Lukens (Matthew), Walker Lukens, Jamie Anne Brown, Michael Taylor Brown; great-grandchildren Jonah Lukens, Zoe Lukens, Audrey Jay Shannon. Brother Albert Ackley, nephew Harold Sprague Ackley, niece Lauren Haber Pebbler, and numerous cousins. Memorial Service will be held at Temple Shaaray Tefila, 250 East 79th Street, NYC 10075 on Friday, July 5th at 3:30pm and Family Service at Rye Presbyterian Church, 882 Boston Post Road, Rye, NY 10580 at 1:00pm. In lieu of flowers or gifts, please donate to PBS (Public Broadcast Service) Foundation: https://pbs.secure.force.com/forms/donate

WURTZEL--Paul Alan, 77, of Charleston, SC, previously of Tenafly, NJ, passed away at home on June 27, 2013. He is survived by his wife Ruth, his daughters, Jessica and Ellen, and five granddaughters. WARNER--Rawleigh, Jr.,a retired Chairman of Mobil Oil Corporation, died June 26 in Hobe Sound, Florida. Cause of death was complications from IBM (Inclusion Body Myositis). Mr. Warner was born on February 13, 1921 in Chicago, Illinois and grew up first in Evanston and then in Winnetka, both suburbs of Chicago. His parents were Rawleigh Warner and Dorothy Haskins Warner. He first attended Lake Forest Academy, then Lawrenceville School in New Jersey and finally Princeton. Following his graduation from Princeton University in 1943, Mr. Warner entered the Army of the United States where he served in the Field Artillery with the 10th Mountain Division in Italy. He was awarded the Silver Star, the Bronze Star and the Purple Heart, eventually leaving the Army as Captain in 1946. Prior to joining Mobil, Mr. Warner worked for CONOCO for five years. Mr. Warner joined Socony Vacuum Company, which later became Mobil Oil Corporation, in the Treasurer's Office in 1953. On January 1, 1965 he was elected President of Mobil Oil Corporation and in 1969, became Chairman and CEO. He retired in 1986. When asked what he thought was the most significant contribution he made to Mobil, he said, "the introduction of a concerted exercise in Executive Development throughout the entire organization". This involved the Executive Committee and all groups below. Over the years, this activity helped to produce a strong team of young maturing executives. Mr. Warner was also instrumental in the development and support of Masterpiece Theater on the Public Broadcasting System, Advocacy Advertising in certain newspapers and magazines, answering many critics of the industry and the modern design of Mobil stations along with the Corporation's logo with the red "O" in Mobil. This later activity was instrumental in letting the public, and particularly Mobil's customers, know that Mobil was a distinctly different and more modern company than that which they had come to know in earlier years. Mr. Warner was a term trustee of Princeton University from 1968 to 1972. He received an Honorary Degree in 1984. From 1981 to 1986 he was Chairman of the Corporation and Foundation Sections of the $53 million campaign and a member of the Resources Committee from 1981 to 1996 for Princeton. He was also a Trustee of Barnard College, Lawrenceville School and the Woodrow Wilson International Center for Scholars. He also received Honorary Degrees from Marietta College in Ohio and Pace University. He served on the Business Roundtable, was chairman of the American Petroleum Institute from which he received their Gold Medal Award, was General Campaign Chairman of the United Fund of Greater New York, member (by Presidential appointment) of the President's Committee for the Arts and served as a Director of American Express, American Telephone and Telegraph, Bristol-Myers Squibb Company, Caterpillar Inc., Chemical Bank, Honeywell, Inc. and Time, Inc. As one of the original Trustees of the Kennedy Center he helped create what is now known as the Kennedy Center. Mr. Warner is survived by his wife, Mary Ann deClairmont Warner, of 66 years, two daughters: Alison (Mrs. Percy R. Pyne, IV), Suzanne (Mrs. Robert W. Parsons), four grandchildren: Rebecca Parsons Bartels, Amalia Pyne Sykes, Rawleigh Warner Pyne, Emily Parsons Talamo, four great grandsons: Graham Howland Bartels, Warner Rutherfurd Talamo, Charles Robert Bartels, and Rawleigh Macrae Sykes and two sisters: Mrs. Dorothy Sills of Wilmette, Illinois and Mrs. Suzanne Kenly of Winnetka, Illinois. He was predeceased by his Mother and Father and by his older sister, Mrs. Mary Clifford.

WALLSTEIN--Eleanor Scholle, 92, died on June 21, 2013, after suffering from Alzheimer's. She was the beloved wife of the late William C. Wallstein and mother of Nancy W. Newkirk, of Bethesda, MD., Richard S. Wallstein, of London, England, and the late Michael W. Wallstein, mother-in-law of Thomas C. Newkirk and Philippa L. Wallstein, grandmother of Jennifer L. Newkirk and Christopher T. Newkirk, grandmother-in-law of Kennon S. Miller and Valeria Van Brummelen, and great-grandmother of Eleanor and Henry Miller and Sophia, Chloe and Brooks Newkirk. Ellie lived in New York City, until she moved to Washington, DC in 2005. She obtained her B.S. from The New School in the 1960's and a Masters from NYU. She was a docent at the Guggenheim Museum and the Metropolitan Museum of Art in NYC, a member of The Cosmopolitan Club of NY and held leadership positions there. She was active in the City Gardens Club, the Women's Prison Association. She was a member of the All Souls Unitarian Church of New York. A Memorial Service was held in Washington, DC. Contributions may be made to The Alzheimer's Association Research, PO Box 96011, Washington, DC 20090 (www.alz.org).

REN--Dr. Myles, on June 20, 2013 of natural causes. At his death, Dr. Ren represented the Economists for Peace and Security to the United Nations, where he served on a number of NGO/UN committees in the fields of human rights, disarmament, sustainable development, education and social development.
